title: Calories in Bone Broth Soup
meta_description: Discover calories in bone broth soup per cup, including protein, sodium, fat, carbs, and tips for variations to fit your diet.
assumptions: Plain bone broth made from beef or chicken bones, simmered 12-24 hours, strained; 240 ml serving, no added vegetables, herbs, or thickeners.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by recipe, bones used (beef/chicken), cooking time, brand, and added ingredients. Check labels for store-bought versions.

quick_answer.text: One cup of bone broth soup contains about 45 calories and 9 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Add mixed vegetables (carrots, onions) per cup
Include chicken meat shreds per cup
Use low-sodium broth base (no salt added)

faqs.q: How many calories in one cup of bone broth soup?
Is bone broth soup high in protein?
faqs.a: Yes, about 9 g protein per cup, mainly from collagen and gelatin.

faqs.q: Why is sodium high in bone broth soup?
faqs.a: Natural extraction from bones and optional added salt; opt for low-sodium versions to reduce it.

faqs.q: Does bone broth have carbs or fat?
faqs.a: Very low: ~1 g carbs and 2 g fat per cup, making it keto-friendly.

faqs.q: How do calories change with homemade vs. store-bought bone broth?
faqs.a: Homemade can be lower (30-50 kcal) without salt; store-bought often higher due to seasonings (50-80 kcal).
